intro: Solidago lapponica, commonly known as Arctic goldenrod, is a low-growing perennial herb native to arctic and alpine regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It typically reaches heights of 10–30 centimeters and is characterized by its dense, hairy foliage and clusters of small, bright yellow flowers. The plant thrives in well-drained, rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to cold climates with short growing seasons. Its flowering period occurs in late summer to early autumn, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Solidago lapponica plays an important ecological role in its habitat by contributing to soil stabilization and providing nectar sources for wildlife.
